snippet: Changing the company’s name can make a big difference, whether to ease confusion, rebuild a brand or flee a negative connotation.
abstract: Nicole LaPorte Prototype column discusses various reasons for changing a company's name; says renaming a business can make a big difference, whether to ease confusion, rebuild a brand or flee a negative connotation; notes that, big or small, companies always face the challenge of telegraphing a new name in a way that does not alienate loyal customers.
lead_paragraph: Changing the company’s name can make a big difference, whether to ease confusion, rebuild a brand or flee a negative connotation.

headline.seo: Renaming a Company Can Be Smart - Prototype
headline.main: If the Name Gets in the Way, Change It
headline.print_headline: If the Name Gets in the Way, Change It
